result.execSummary:
The defendant Cody Wes Kraabel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Obtain and maintain full time employment in an occupation that meets with agent's approval and not quit employment without agent's approval.

Undergo psychological evaluation and comply with recommendations.

No consumption or possession of alcoholic beverages.  No entering bars, taverns or liquor stores.

Obey all no contact orders per agent.

Obtain housing that is approved by agent.

Cooperate with appropriate child support agency in establishing child support order for his minor child and comply with all family court orders regarding support, legal custody and physical placement.

Obey all rules of supervision per agent including any programming or counseling deemed necessary by agent.

Submit DNA sample.

Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
